noun.description: A narrow horizontal surface projecting from a wall, cliff, or other surface.
examples: he heaved himself up over a ledge

noun.description: An underwater ridge, especially of rocks beneath the sea near the shore.
A stratum of metal- or ore-bearing rock; a vein of quartz or other mineral.

origin: Middle English (denoting a strip of wood or other material fixed across a door, gate, etc.): perhaps from an early form of lay. ledge (sense 1) dates from the mid 16th century.
